meanings.definition: A hydrous aluminum silicate mineral that is a component of some soils.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the allophane under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use allophane to improve the quality of their soil.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook allophane for a precious gem.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare and beautiful as allophane in the soil.
meanings.sent5: The allophane sparkled like tiny diamonds in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A gelatinous substance formed by the weathering of volcanic ash.
meanings.sent1: After the eruption, the valley was covered in allophane.
meanings.sent2: The artist used allophane to create a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added allophane instead of gelatin to the dessert.
meanings.sent4: The allophane oozed out of the cracks in the volcanic rock.
meanings.sent5: The touch of allophane was cool and slippery on her skin.
